title: Data Analyst

body:
About the company

At Covera Health, we have proven that advanced data science can prevent serious misdiagnoses which result in poor outcomes for patients and increased costs for payers. Using our proprietary framework, we help patients recover better, faster, and more affordably. Today, we are working with some of the largest healthcare payers in the country to potentially impact millions of patient lives. We are passionate about improving healthcare for every patient.

About the role

We are looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst to join us in our commitment to improve the quality of care for patients in every community across the nation. As a Senior Data Analyst at Covera Health, it is crucial that you have experience maintaining databases and using data sets to produce detailed and insightful reports. You will work within our Provider Partnerships team to build data management and reporting practices, and work cross functionally with our Data Science, Engineering, and... Operations teams to respond to a variety of data analysis and reporting requests.

You will contribute to the development of a strong data management discipline to manage our provider data. You will develop a complete understanding of data flows through our provider data management and quality assessment process and use that understanding to create processes that will help us manage our data. A key part of this role will be creating reports and user-friendly tools to structure data for team review.

You will be expected to:
• Work with a variety of healthcare data, including longitudinal claims data, healthcare provider profile data, medical images, medical reports, and proprietary diagnostic imaging exam quality assessment data
• Contribute to the creation and development of data systems and processes by building user-friendly tools, reports, dashboards, and queries
• Apply critical thinking of provider data flows and data requirements across the organization to contribute to developing strong data management practices
• Efficiently pull data from various internal and external sources
• Maintain, enhance, and deploy data analysis and reporting pipelines
• Support data management and ingestion processes, including entering, cleaning, formatting, and importing data
• Contribute to the design of longer-term data management approach by developing requirements with Engineering and Data Science teams and supporting development of proof of concept solutions
• Collaborate on data analysis projects and communication of results to internal and external stakeholders

Requirements
• 2-3 years work experience as a data analyst or business analyst
• Fluent in SQL and scripting in Python
• Experience producing in-depth analyses and reporting in a self-directed environment
• BS or Masters degree in computer science or related technology
• Experience working with medical data is a plus

Benefits

You will be a full-time employee with competitive salary, stock options, and great benefits. These benefits include medical, dental, and vision insurance (with premiums fully covered), FSA, pre-tax commuter benefits, flexible paid time off, and a comfortable office space filled with a variety of quality snacks and beverages. Most importantly, you’ll get to know each of us and we love to work together to find solutions. We are a smart, fun, focused, and unique team of people who are truly passionate about changing healthcare for the better
title: Senior Data Analyst

body:
The Role

We are looking for an analyst with technical skills and business savvy to work on tools, systems and analyses that give us transparency into our business and help us make better decisions. Your role is to maximize the business value of data to WeWork Labs. This is a full-stack role that will involve conducting in-depth analysis of business problems, building data tools, and acting as a data partner for stakeholders across the WeWork Labs organization. You are a positive, hard-working and curious generalist with a track record of using data to influence your business. This is a superb opportunity for you to help this team manage the challenges of rapid global expansion, understand its customers & operations, and measure its performance.
About the Team

Launched in early 2018, WeWork Labs is WeWork’s innovation platform that supports early-stage startups and corporations seeking to transform their industries. With a range of offerings, WeWork Labs helps growing startups... through customized programming, and bridges the gap to enterprise organizations through corporate innovation programs, labs, and services.
Responsibilities:
• You will build and maintain reporting dashboards and management tools to help stakeholders make decisions
• You will develop and manage systems and data models for new and rapidly-evolving business processes - including our sales funnel, global expansion, member value programming and more
• You will systematically improve our operations by identifying opportunities, deriving business hypotheses on how we might leverage those opportunities, and validating those hypotheses through experimentation
• Institute data capture systems and processes to help us understand what’s going on in our business and in our spaces around the world
• Capture data and use that insight to identify creative ways to improve financial and operational performance

Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
• 3+ years working with data every day, ideally with 5+ years professional experience working on business or technology problems
• Expertise in at least one modern SQL-based business intelligence tool, Looker preferred
• A love for solving intellectually challenging problems
• Proven skills in data extraction, munging, analysis, statistics, & visualization (e.g. SQL, Python, & R)
• Excellent written & verbal communication skills; ability to collaborate with software engineers as well as non-technical business owners
• Ability to strike the balance between working independently and knowing when to ask for help
• Positive, mature, hands-on attitude, with demonstrated history of good judgment

About WeWork:

WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide beautiful workspace, an inspiring community, and meaningful business services to tens of thousands of members around the world. Our mission is to create a world where people work to make a life, not just a living. WeWork members are creators who run the gamut from entrepreneurs, freelancers, and startups, to artists, small businesses and even divisions of large corporations. Beyond providing workspace for our members, we actively look for opportunity to provide services and experiences to foster an engaged and growing community of creators. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status
title: Senior Data Analyst - WeWork Labs

body:
Senior Data Analyst will become an expert and champion of RCA’s industry leading proprietary data, interacting with various teams across the company to serve different business needs. We expect the Senior Data Analyst to aid various teams in drawing insight from our data. This includes creating templates, dashboards, visualizations, algorithms and business tools for use across the organization. If you enjoy collaborating cross-functionally, and are excited to work with large amounts of data to create actionable insights then this is a great opportunity to grow your skills and contribute!
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Support internal teams and key stakeholders to formalize and present a variety of CRE custom analysis.
• Provide innovative and practical solutions to a wide range of complex research and analytical problems by leveraging RCA’s proprietary databases.
• Collaborate with engineers and key stakeholders in RCA’s machine learning objectives.
• Work with clients and... other industry participants on an ad-hoc basis.
• Communicate technical concepts and analyses to different audiences.

Experience/Skills
• Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics or a related discipline is preferred.
• Strong quantitative and analytical skills; ability to define metrics that tell the right story in the data.
• Experience managing and analyzing large datasets in Microsoft Excel, SQL, Python, R, SAS, and Tableau or other BI and/or data visualization tools is greatly preferred.
• Prior experience in data linkage and the demonstrated ability to understand and articulate the mechanics of data linkage
• The ideal applicant is well-organized, exceptionally detail-orientated, resourceful, comfortable working independently in an entrepreneurial environment, and has an analytical mindset with a curiosity for commercial real estate
title: Senior Data Analyst

body:
VMLY&R is all about putting everything you are into everything you do. We're a full-service advertising agency that thrives on moving brands forward by inspiring a human connection.

The Strategy & Insights team is growing and looking for a Senior Analyst to join the Analytics and Data Insights practice. As a Senior Analyst, you will be working in a cross-functional environment and analyzing data to identify marketing opportunities for client partners. As a key member of the team, you will be providing actionable insights to stakeholders and determining appropriate data-driven recommendations that inform business and marketing decisions.Responsibilities
• Synthesize and interpret marketing data into a narrative of business performance and actionable insights delivered through analytics reports and reporting dashboards.
• Drive campaign measurement for marketing programs including the creation of measurement frameworks that identify KPIs and diagnostic measures.
• Conduct ongoing... behavior tracking and deep-dive analysis on results across various digital channels including website, social media, search, display, emails, and affiliates
• Extract data from digital toolsincluding Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, native social platforms, and 3rd party enterprise social platforms
• Manage data accuracy and integrity for client marketing programs
• Plan, implement and manage marketing optimization programs (e.g.: A/B testing)
• Create and design business and marketing dashboards that align to client program objectives and various audiencesusing tools like Tableau, Google Data Studio, and Datorama
• Implement, collect, and analyze natural language data across social media platforms using tools like Crimson Hexagon
• Present ongoing strategic recommendations to clients
• Assist with development and mentorship of interns, associate analysts, and analysts

As part of the WPP Group, VMLY&R offers one of the best overall compensation packages in the business. Required Skills & Experience
• BA/BS Degree
• 4-6 years of experience working in digital marketing analytics 
• Deep experience in data analysis and report generation through tools such as Excel, SPSS, Tableau, etc.
• Experience working independently, self-managing, and managing others on projects to deliver results supporting multiple clients and stakeholders 
• Hands-on experience with web analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc.) 
• Experience with multivariate and experimental test platform (Adobe Target, Optimizely, Visual Website Optimizer, etc.) 
• Experience with implementing website analytics tags and pixels as well as working in tag management platforms (Google Tag Manager, Adobe Launch)
• Experience with social listening tools (Crimson Hexagon, Infegy, Talkwalker, Spredfast, etc.)
• Experience with predictive analytics and CRM applications a plus 
• Experience extracting and analyzing data from paid media platforms is a plus (DoubleClick, Facebook Ads, etc.)
• CPG or Healthcare experience a plus

VMLY&R is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law

body:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is seeking a temporary worker to support our Partnerships team, working within Partnerships Analytics. The Partnerships team works with the leading content creators in the world, in entertainment, sports, news, and other verticals. This role entails using SQL to pull queries from... our internal database, helping internal stakeholders understand how to use and interpret data from internal dashboards, confirming that data requests comply with our data policy, and responding to and aggregating data requests into common use cases so that the team can understand which new pipelines or metrics are needed. The role may also include generating pipelines and new data structures that will enable easier dashboard creation in the future, as time allows.

The role will work within the Partnerships Analytics team and is based in New York, NY.

Responsibilities

Primary
• Query data and provide reports/query results to stakeholders
• Manage requests and priorities independently
• Provide documentation of queries/inbound for future data infrastructure builds and future requirements

Secondary
• Improve existing dashboards by adding new metrics to support Partnerships and other teams within the company
• Communicate with internal stakeholders about dashboards, and provide support about which metrics are available and from where
• Understand existing data policy restrictions and determine if queries are possible to run/share
• Ability to work in a high-pressured environment
• Ability to juggle and prioritize multiple requests
• Ability to communicate complex data issues to audiences of different levels of technical expertise

Minimum Qualifications
• SQL proficiency; 2+ years of experience pulling data independently using SQL
• Experience working independently

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience building out large data sets and pipelines
• Python or similar scripting experience

A Bachelors, Masters or PhD degree in one of the following areas: Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Physics
title: Data Analyst (8943145)

body:
About Trialspark

Today, the biggest bottleneck in bringing new treatments to patients is the clinical trial. On average, getting a drug through the trial process takes nearly a decade and frequently costs $100M+. And the problem is only getting worse.

At TrialSpark, we don’t believe it has to be this way. Through technology and a new operational model, we’re reimaging how clinical trials are run, with the mission of bringing new treatments to patients faster.

We do this by partnering with physicians to enable them to run clinical trials within their existing practices. By providing the technology platform, equipment, and staffing,TrialSpark alleviates the operational burden of clinical research, enabling physicians to focus on what they do best -- patient care. And by bringing clinical research to physician practices, TrialSpark is enabling access for the 98% of patients who are never exposed to clinical trial opportunities.

About the role

Delivering a clinical trial across... multiple trial sites is a highly complex endeavor, involving lots of different people, processes, and logistics. And running numerous clinical trials at once, across a nationwide site network, increases the complexity of the problem exponentially.

As a Senior Operations Analyst, your focus will be helping us to manage this complexity. You will be responsible for developing a deep, data-driven understanding of our operational model and identifying the key leverage points to drive greater efficiency. You’ll map out the exact activities required to deliver a clinical trial and locate opportunities to reduce time and cost. Example questions you’ll help us answer include:
• How many people do we need to staff a clinical trial? What are the primary drivers of the size and makeup of the team? Given the needs of the trial and the workloads, capabilities, and geographical locations of the various team members, who should be included in the team?
• What does it cost to run a clinical trial? What are the major drivers of these costs and what improvements can we make to the model to drive efficiency? Where do we build vs. buy software?
• In what ways can we optimize our physical trial operations? Can we better route our staff and resources between sites? What does an efficient clinical logistics network look like?
• Based on the forecasted growth of the business, how many people do we need to hire for each role, and by when?

About you

This is a core operational role for TrialSpark, We’re looking for highly talented candidates with an extensive background in analytical problem solving. Candidates for this role should be able to take complex, open-ended problems and develop structured, data-driven solutions.

An ideal candidate:
• You have a deep analytical background with experience in an Operational science or research capacity, and are passionate about breaking down and understanding complex systems end-to-end. Prior experience could include data science, operations, consulting, or finance.
• You have strong technical chops — you’ve lived in Excel, can write SELECT statements in your sleep, and can Python or R your way in and out of any situation.
• You are excited about working cross-functionally with operations, finance, product, engineering, and data to develop innovative solutions to challenging operational problems.
• You are proactive, strategic, implementation-focused, and ready to roll up your sleeves and make an impact right away
• You are low ego, collaborative, and a fast-learner

You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status

title: Data Analyst

body:
The Role

This is an opportunity to join a small, growing team and make a substantial impact at Bowery. We’re looking for someone that can learn, adapt and roll with a fast-paced, ever-changing environment and who isn’t afraid of uncertainty.

Data analysis at Bowery means building data pipelines, crafting data visualizations, and helping a wide range of teams interpret reams of data generated by “the Techiest Farm in the World.” The data function at Bowery is central to the vision of the company as well as its day to day operation. You’ll be part the Data & AI team which is responsible for everything from collecting data, to reporting facts, to building machine learning and computer vision models, to robotics automation.

What you’ll do at Bowery
• Develop SQL to transform the raw data produced by the farm into a comprehensive data warehouse as the authoritative source for all facts about the business.
• Build automated reporting which effectively draws attention to important... information and helps decision makers understand our priorities.
• Partner with other functional areas to develop metrics, understand analytical needs, and interpret results about our crops and our business.
• Collaborate on the design and creation of data tools used by our farm operators, agricultural scientists, and sales team.
• Contribute to Bowery’s data-driven culture, and influence best practices.

Who you are
• You have a BA or BS in a quantitative discipline and 2-5 years experience answering data questions in a fast-paced technical business environment.
• You are fluent in SQL, have opinions about a well-designed database, and know how to deal with data too big to analyze in-memory.
• You are comfortable working in a highly technical team: contributing through version control, peer-reviewing code, and managing processes in production.
• You are comfortable being the technical resource for non-technical teams: translating business needs to technical requirements, communicating quantitative observations to make the teams around us more effective and well-informed.
• You’ve got a natural attention to detail and drive for order that yields accuracy and reliability in the data you work with. You can own the critical trust-based relationship with our internal stakeholders.
• You have experience in and a passion for visualizing data to tell clear stories and support decision making.
• You have some familiarity with data science languages like R or python, and enjoy learning more.
• You’re confident taking ownership of projects from start to finish and enjoy the process of turning nebulous ideas into reality.
• You believe that teams succeed and fail together and take responsibility for ensuring the success and safety of your teammates.
• *To be considered for the role, Please include a response to the following question in your cover letter:

Imagine a table named crop_masses in an Amazon Redshift database. It has four columns:

- crop_id [int]

- crop_type_id [int]

- harvested_on [timestamp]

- harvested_mass_grams [double]

Write a SQL query which summarizes the typical harvested_mass per crop in pounds by crop_type_id over time.

About Bowery

Bowery is growing food for a better future by revolutionizing agriculture. Our modern farming company combines the benefits of the best local farms with advances made possible by technology to grow post-organic produce you can feel good about eating. BoweryOS, our proprietary software system, uses vision systems, automation technology, and machine learning to monitor plants and all the variables that drive their growth 24/7. Because we control the entire process from seed to store, Bowery farms use zero pesticides, 95% less water, and are 100+ times more productive on the same footprint of land than traditional agriculture. Bowery produce is currently available at select Whole Foods and Foragers stores in the Tristate area, and featured on the menus of Tom Colicchio’s New York restaurants Craft and Temple Court. Based in New York City, the company has raised $27.5M from leading investors including General Catalyst, GGV Capital, GV (formerly Google Ventures) and First Round Capital.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status
title: Data Analyst

body:
The Orchard is seeking a Data Analyst to join our NYC base team.

Responsibilities

• Execute internal and external client requests for analytics & BI support, projects and analyses

• Assist in creating compelling analytics projects and presentations, which tell an analytic story, demonstrating their value by providing actionable insights paired with recommendations

• Execute advanced and optimized modeling and SQL commands for supporting client requirements

• Assist in designing client-specific strategic service offerings and approaches that will quantitatively demonstrate value through the development and implementation of fresh and innovative analytics and marketing approaches that deliver business results

• Compile updates for management as needed on the analytics services team. Execute tickets to support all submitted requests

• Support the analytics services team by collecting stakeholder feedback, upholding processes, and maintaining internal documentation

• Assist with... the development of data visualization toolkit to enable clients and their marketing teams visualize richer insights for client executives and stakeholders.

• Assist with the development and implementation of multimedia education initiatives for internal BI tools and client facing analysis tools

Qualifications

• Minimum 2 years experience in analytics, BI, data insights, marketing, and strategy, preferably within the music and/or distribution industry

• Technical skills in data management (preferred) - SQL, python, R, javascript (D3), CSS

• Experience with specific BI Looker, Snowflake, Tableau, Mode, Google Analytics, Data Studio and/or other BI tools A BIG PLUS

• Proven experience working closely with clients to understand key business questions. Experience Leading client teams and internal cross-functional staff to define scope of projects

• Interest in experimenting with 3rd party data sources to enrich behavioral data for client insights deliverables

• Ability to manage deadlines and lead client engagements from initial discussion through delivery of work

• Ability to communicate and share information effectively with clients, executives, development teams, stakeholders and fellow analytics/BI team members

• Self-starter and strategic project management master with tenacity to experiment in order to create opportunities and solve problems

• Interest in the music industry and the numbers behind music consumption

• Knowledge of and passion for independent music, and the ability to identify trends and an awareness of what’s popular today and its place in pop culture

• Clear and consistent communicator with strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
title: Data Analyst, Analytics Services

body:

title: Data Analyst

body:
ABOUT US

Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We're a data-first marketing platform startup, and we approach our work seriously; we tackle problems in a scrappy and disruptive fashion, yet we build for scale to support our clients at big data volume.

We are the first and only enterprise customer data platform with a fully-integrated marketing cloud. Moving beyond the limitations of both categories, Simons platform empowers businesses to leverage enterprise-scale big data and machine learning to power customer communications in any channel. Simons unique approach allows brands to develop incredible personalization capabilities without needing to build and maintain massive bespoke data infrastructure.

Our culture is rooted in organizational transparency, empowering individuals, and an attitude of getting things done. If you want to be a valuable contributor on a team that cultivates these core values we would love to hear from you.

THE... ROLE

As Simons Marketing Data Analyst you will scale our predictive features ability to analyze data efficiently and meaningfully. In this role you will be responsible for developing general schemata for product and marketing data, and use them to align and report on quality and integrity of complex datasets. You will produce clear, statistically rigorous analyses of complex datasets for consumption by an audience of marketing professionals and domain experts. You will get to explore complex datasets to drive advanced segmentation and campaign efficacy analyses.

This role is crucial to the business as we expand our capabilities and intelligence tools to our customers. You are the right person for this role if you have a high proficiency in communicating data insights to non technical stakeholders, are creative in your approach to finding solutions for current data sets and able to iterate as needed, and have a strong desire to learn new skills and technical approaches as you advance your career in data science.

WHAT YOULL DO
• Write SQL queries in a number of dialects to extract and schematize diverse data sets
• Analyze ad transform data in order to derive meaningful insights for customers and internal stakeholders
• Creatively generate clear visualizations of large and complex data sets
• Extract features from data that use calculated insights to improve performance of statistical models that drive Simons products

QUALIFICATIONS
• M.S. Data Science/Statistics or related field, or equivalent experience
• 2+ years working in digital marketing, business analysis, or related field
• 1+ years experience writing SQL queries
• Practical experience visualizing complex datasets (R/ggplot, python/matplotlib, SAS/Tableau, Excel, etc.)
• Meaningful experience writing Python or other production coding language (Java, C#, etc) is a plus

Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available

Diversity

Were proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status
title: Marketing Data Analyst

body: As a data analyst you will be working with a team of about 10 other analysts, providing data analysis, modeling, and engineering to create new reporting feeds for new development stemming for current initiatives. You will work closely with business stakeholders and other development teams to gather/understand current system architecture and help formulate new strategic builds. Currently there are 2 major initiatives resulting in the need to augment the team: 1. Brexit- need to create entire new entity for UK markets to trade PB 2. Decomm the current application (MLPro) used to book all trades and build out new functionality in new system Must-haves -4+ years of Data Analysis experience -Expert knowledge of SQL -Experienced with Data Modeling -General functional knowledge of capital markets Plusses -Python -Functional knowledge of a) Equity products: trade lifecycle- amendments, settlements, position, how systems record and track this data or b)Prime Brokerage - Reporting/BI tools such... as Cognos, ETL tools such as Informatica and large warehouses
title: Data Analyst

body:
Job Title: Senior Master Data Analyst
Location: NYC (SOHO)
Job Type: Contract
Duration: 6-12 months
Contact Info: Ella Blank - eblank@techlink.com - 201-786-2414

Job Summary:
• Master Data Analyst is an exciting and critical new role that will ultimately help shape the company's ability to support decision-making with accurate, consistent data. This individual will work cross functionally to build and maintain the company's core data going forward.
• For the first 6 month, the Master Data Analyst will work with Director of Enterprise Applications, key supply chain stakeholders (Director of Supply Chain Planning, Head of Supply Chain) and key stakeholders in Production (designers, merchandizers) to build and maintain a comprehensive Item Master.
• As the company is embarking on the ERP implementation, Master Data Analyst will be an integral part of the company implementation team, responsible for data migration, understanding key integration points/entry points for data, in addition... to other tasks.
• This role will evolve over time and offers the opportunity to be a key member in a high visibility ERP implementation in addition to eventually being the company's most reliable keeper of data.

Primary Responsibilities and duties:
• Quickly get up to speed on different sources of data (POS, ecommerce engine, purchase order database) and their taxonomy & reporting structures
• Build and maintain item master drawing on data from multiple sources and proposing/adding addition levels of detail and attribution
• Develop a comprehensive understanding of business systems, business units and procedures to work effectively across the organization to capture information not residing within data sources
• Work to support data related topics throughout ERP implementation
• Following implementation, maintain, vet, and periodically clean centralized master data
• Track and communicate key metrics for measuring success
• Maintain and protect sensitive information with a high level of confidentiality

Education and Experience:
• BS in math, statistics, computer programming, data science or IT
• 2-4 years' experience in technology or data related role
• SAP experience required

Additional Skills / Tasks:
• Advanced excel skills
• SQL / database experience a plus
• Maintain positive collaborative environment
• Communication and leadership with an entrepreneurial mindset

All offers of employment at TechLink, Inc. are contingent upon clear results of a thorough background check.

Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates.

Background checks will include: Social Security Verification, Prior Employment Verification, Professional References, Educational Verification, Criminal History, Motor Vehicle Records and e-verify
title: Senior Master Data Analyst

body:
Fluent is a leading performance marketing company with an expertise in delivering measurable results. We interact with 1MM US consumers daily across our owned and operated websites. Our team uses the insights gathered from these interactions to drive growth for our partners. Through engaging digital experiences, Fluent creates meaningful and lasting connections between brands and consumers.

As a Data Analyst, you will use your leadership skills, technology insight, business acumen and creativity as the team builds data pipelines and tools to automate reporting and generate insight. You will use a data driven approach to sharpen decision making and drive understanding of our fast-growing business. In this role, you'll be building scalable solutions that will help make data relevant to Fluent’s Performance Marketing Group on current and historical performance and visualizing the key opportunities for growth. Using your technical skills, you will build tools to automate reporting and... dashboard updates so that Team Leads across Fluent’s different business lines can see quickly and accurately how their businesses are performing.

Responsibilities:
• Translate business needs into technical requirements
• Build reports, dashboards, models and tools to analyze, report, and present operations related data
• Develop Data Warehousing and Reporting solutions to address the growing business reporting, analytics and data requirements
• Effective project leadership related to Data Analytics
• Brainstorm possible new metrics and/or processes that will lead to revenue growth and/or improved efficiencies
• Passion for learning new products and technologies and maintaining a toolkit of skills
• Develop own vision and opinions whilst also working as part of a team
• 2-4 years of prior experience required
• The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in the development of new Data Automation and Analytical techniques.
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
• Experience working with statistical and analytic methodologies using R and Python
• Experience with databases, including SQL coding across standard commercial databases (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc).
• Data Visualization skills
• Highly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently, while also able to build strong internal relationships and build consensus on critical initiatives
• Ability to learn quickly and work in a constantly changing fast-growing start-up environment
• Rigorous yet creative analytic approach that enables superior business outcomes

At Fluent, we like what we do and we like who we do it with. Our team is a tight-knit crew of go-getters; we love to celebrate our successes! In addition to two fully-stocked kitchens, catered breakfast and lunch, and free workout classes on site, our office manager keeps the calendar stocked with activity-filled events. When we’re not eating, working out, or planning parties, Fluent folks can be found participating in recreational sports leagues, networking with She Runs It, and bonding with across teams during quarterly outings to baseball games, fancy dinners, and pizza-making classes. And we have all the practical benefits, too…
• Competitive salary
• Discounted gym memberships
• Ample career and professional growth opportunities
• Open office space for team collaboration
• Health, dental, and vision insurance
• 401K with generous employer match
• The amazing opportunity to work for a high-flying performance marketing company
title: Data Analyst

body:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help drive a data-first culture with a focus on growth. You will study customer behavior, strategic initiatives, markets, and bring data and insights into every decision we make. Above all, your work will impact how we think about growth and how we can make Kencko’s products available and accessible to everyone around the world.

You will report directly to the CMO.

What you’ll do:

• Development and ownership of Kencko’s LTV framework

• Forecast modeling (consumer behavior and company key metrics)

• Acquisition, Activation, Retention and Conversion analytics

• You have at least 5+ years of experience in a similar growth data scientist role and a degree in science... computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or similar quantitative discipline

• You have the technical competence to perform more advanced analytics

Coding skills (such as Python, Java, or Scala)

• Analytics tools experience (such as Pandas, R, SPSS, SQL, or Hadoop)

• You are a self-driven person who’s capable of tackling very loosely defined problems

• You are a communicative person that values building strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders and have the ability to explain complex topics in simple terms

• Your dream is to join an early stage startup building great products that your friends and family will love

Benefits Include:

• Competitive salary

• Stock options

• A casual, dynamic, ambitious, and fun work environment

• Health dental, and vision insurance

• English or Portuguese language courses

• Open vacation policy

• Lots of responsibility
title: Data Analyst

body:
Our client, a leading energy services company, is seeking an IT Business/Data Analyst.

Location: New York, NY

Position Type: Contract

Summary:

-Our client is looking for an IT Business/Data Analyst with strong analytical skills with the ability to Identify and lead complex problems and situations, often involving cross system issues, to successful resolution.

-Must be able to query multiple data sources, look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to conclusions based on the findings.

-Looking for a team player who needs minimal direction and can handle multiple assignments at one time.

-This is a "hands-on" position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

-Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

-Perform other related tasks and assignments as required.

-Maintain SSIS packages

The following are not required for this position but would be considered as a valuable asset in a potential candidate.

title: IT Business/Data Analyst

body:
Description: POSITION SUMMARY
The Sr. Consultant Data Analytics for Enterprise Intelligence will objectively represent the consumer perspective to guide business decisions, and inspire action across the Aetna enterprise. This particular role within our Insight Lab is uniquely situated at the intersection of Big Data and Market Research to understand both the what and why of member experience. The successful candidate will be able to leverage strong data analytic skills to deliver deep insights on Aetna members, and be passionate about being the voice of our members.

Fundamental Components:
• Work with manager to coordinate the execution of critical Aetna member satisfaction surveys, including responsibility for accurate and timely business reporting.
• Use modeling and machine learning skills to generate insights and predictions by leveraging large amounts of internal data and existing survey data.
• Analyze survey attitudinal data and Aetna behavioral metrics together to provide... business partners with deep insights into member experience. * Provide Enterprise Intelligence expertise on the Aetna Enterprise Data Warehouse to support ad hoc needs of business partners. * Consult on uses of behavioral data to solve business questions and drive thought leadership.

BACKGROUND/EXPERIENCE desired:
• Work with manager to coordinate the execution of critical Aetna member satisfaction surveys, including responsibility for accurate and timely business reporting.
• Use modeling and machine learning skills to generate insights and predictions by leveraging large amounts of internal data and existing survey data.
• Analyze survey attitudinal data and Aetna behavioral metrics together to provide business partners with deep insights into member experience. * Provide Enterprise Intelligence expertise on the Aetna Enterprise Data Warehouse to support ad hoc needs of business partners. * Consult on uses of behavioral data to solve business questions and drive thought leadership.
• Strong skills in SQL, SAS Eg, R or Python & with hadoop tech including Hive and/or Pig. * Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel & PowerPoint * Experience developing ETL processes. * Experience building Datamarts and predictive models. * Experience with Qualtrics & Tableau preferred. * Ability to work with large data sets from multiple data sources. * Strong analytic and data interpretation skills * Familiarity with basic multivariate statistical analysis. * A passion to help transform health care.

EDUCATION
The highest level of education desired for candidates in this position is a Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.

TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCES
Technical - Development Languages/SQL/1-3 Years/Power User
Technical - Subject Disciplines///

ADDITIONAL JOB INFORMATION
Aetna is evolving from a health insurer to a health company. To support the rapid growth and change, the Enterprise Intelligence Department is moving from a research to a Brand Planning model. That means becoming consultative partners to our internal clients and using multi-disciplinary problem solving techniques to reach actionable insights that drive disruptive innovation across product and service development, customer experience design, and marketing. This role is vital to enable us to drive growth in the company and to scale to meet demand.

Aetna is about more than just doing a job. This is our opportunity to re-shape healthcare for America and across the globe. We are developing solutions to improve the quality and affordability of healthcare. What we do will benefit generations to come.

We care about each other, our customers and our communities. We are inspired to make a difference, and we are committed to integrity and excellence.

Together we will empower people to live healthier lives.

Aetna is an equal opportunity & affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select and develop women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities.

We are a company built on excellence. We have a culture that values growth, achievement and diversity and a workplace where your voice can be heard.

Benefit eligibility may vary by position. Click here to review the benefits associated with this position.

Aetna takes our candidates's data privacy seriously. At no time will any Aetna recruiter or employee request any financial or personal information (Social Security Number, Credit card information for direct deposit, etc.) from you via e-mail. Any requests for information will be discussed prior and will be conducted through a secure website provided by the recruiter. Should you be asked for such information, please notify us immediately.

title: Data Analyst, Senior Consultant

body:
Fair Fares Integrity Data Analyst
City Research Scientist - II

NYC Human Resources Administration – Department of Social Services
Office of Program Accountability/1838

The Office of Program Accountability (OPA) is responsible for protecting the integrity of social services programs administered by the New York City Human Resources Administration (HRA), and ensuring that DSS-HRA-DHS is in compliance with all statutory, regulatory, and contractual standards.

The Fair Fares Integrity and Review (FFIR) Unit will be responsible for conducting backend investigations into fraud, abuse, eligibility verification, and quality assurance for the program and its clients. FFIR will provide support with identifying integrity risk and preempting program and fiscal damages with sufficient advance notice to determine and implement timely mitigation and cost avoidance measures.

The Office of Program Accountability is recruiting for one (1) City Research Scientist II to function as Fair Fares... Integrity Data Analyst who will:
• Provide analytical support in the areas of data reporting, data analysis, and quality assurance for the
Fair Fares Integrity and Review (FFIR) Unit. Analyze and Identify complex data mining and data
matching projects designed to enhance the agency's ability to identify potential fraudulent vulnerabilities for HRA /non-HRA clients. This includes identifying correlations, patterns and trends among data elements in large databases; using ad-hoc queries to investigate data verification in various source systems such as LexisNexis; and developing statistical reports on findings and recommendations.
• Review referrals from HRA or inter/intra city agencies including Metropolitan Transit Authority (MTA), based on data trends of clients who have suspicious usage of transit cards. Liaise with MTA fraud detection unit to identify fraud, abuse, and misuse.
• Conduct reviews and internal systematic ad-hoc inquiries of access patterns utilized by city workers.
Create a tracking system with signoffs and periodic audit/reviews of access patterns. Provide written
reports and recommendations.
• Conduct data research and run queries on questionable activities of clients who may be committing
potential fraud. Maintain a system of performance benchmarks for the FFIR unit as part of the agency’s overall system for monitoring institutional effectiveness and will periodically evaluate and report on the effectiveness of the Agency’s Fair Fares Integrity program.
• Provide analytical support to the Director of DART and the Fair Fares Integrity Review unit. Provide
project management support and oversee research, reviews and analytical support at all project
phases, including planning, design, development, testing, and implementation as it pertains to data
integration, data reporting and data sharing projects.

Requirements:
1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health.
To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have:
1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or
2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or
3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above.

NOTE:
Probationary Period
Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.

Preferred Skills:
• Knowledge of modern statistical methods.
• Experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing data from large databases.
• Microsoft Excel, Project, Visio, and Access.
• Excellent written, verbal, interpretive and interpersonal skills.
• Excellent organizational skills.
• Proficiency with a statistical software package, preferably R, SAS, Stata, or MATLAB.
• SQL programming experience highly desirable, but not required.

Salary Range: $73,305 - 92,001 (Annual)
New York City offers an excellent and comprehensive benefits package.
For consideration, please go to http://www1.nyc.gov/jobs and search for Job ID # 374809 to apply.

SUBMISSION OF A RESUME IS NOT A GUARANTEE THAT YOU WILL RECEIVE AN INTERVIEW.
HRA/DSS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
company: NYC Human Resources Administration – Department of Social Services
title: Fair Fares Integrity Data Analyst

body:
Bluecore is an Inc. 500 high-growth marketing technology company. Bluecore has been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Glassdoor and is ranked No. 241 on the Inc. 500 List, the most prestigious ranking of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies. Our Retail Performance Cloud, specializing in artificial intelligence - based workflows. Our unique ability to leverage machine learning to match customer data with real-time product and behavior enables brands to build intelligent, marketing communications and personalized campaigns in seconds vs. days. More than 400 retail brands, including Staples, Perry Ellis, Teleflora, Tommy Hilfiger, and Best Buy Canada, increase their performance with less effort leveraging our products.

Bluecore’s Data Insights and Strategy team have two key focuses - First to deliver custom deep dive analysis to our largest enterprise clients, and second to productize and scale the most relevant insights so that they can be delivered to hundreds... of clients. As an Insights Analyst on the team, your job would be to mine, explore, and analyze terabytes of behavioral data and digital marketing engagement data from across 300+ retail brands to discover and deliver insights and strategy for our clients.

We’re looking for a highly motivated data analyst with a strong technical background and a knack for interpreting and communicating the “why” behind data and its application to business. We are looking for candidates with fluency in SQL, Python, and Excel, who enjoys and appreciates creative thinking, relentlessly digging into data, and turning the results into clearly communicated and compelling strategies. You’ll be working closely with the other analysts and strategists on the Insights team, as well as Bluecore’s customer success and sales teams to deliver insights to our clients. You will be responsible for discovering, solving, and communicating the business problems that our brands face and working with our engineering teams to create automated solutions.
Responsibilities
• Build, maintain and improve custom models that help our clients solve specific retail marketing goals such as getting buyers to buy in a new category.
• Design and build KPI reports and visualizations in Excel, Jupyter Notebooks, and Looker to help make our teams and clients successful.
• Work with the analysts and strategists to help form strategies based on our insights to help our clients reach their business goals.
• Track and monitor the performance of our strategy recommendations. Provide recommendations for optimizations.
• Work with customers and internal customer success and sales teams to discover the challenges faced by our clients.
• Work with engineers to generalize and automate analysis developed on Jupyter Notebooks, Excel, and Looker using tools such as Pandas, Airflow, Google BigQuery, and CloudSQL.

Requirements
• Position is located in our New York City office.
• Bachelors degree in analytical fields such as Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics preferred.
• 2+ years experience in business analysis, consulting, data analysis or other similarly analytical roles, preferably related with large datasets.
• Retail e-commerce analytics experience is a plus.
• Ability to operate comfortably and effectively in a fast-paced, highly cross-functional, rapidly changing environment.
• Experience with R, Python or other languages for data analysis is a must.
• Fluency in SQL and Python a must.
• Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.
• Excellent communication skills for cross-team collaboration.
• Experience creating dashboards with Looker, Periscope, and other similar data visualization tools required.
• Knowledge of statistics a plus.

Benefits
• Amazing team environment recognized by Glassdoor and other culture assessment companies. Certified great places to work by the Great Place to Work Institute
• Come work with passionate, energetic, curious people solving customer problems
• Competitive compensation package including salary and comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
• Equity in a rapidly growing, early-stage Inc. 500 marketing technology growth company
• Generous Parental Leave & flexible vacation policy
• 401(k) plan
• Monthly fitness stipend for a gym membership or fitness classes
• Monthly public transportation stipend

At Bluecore we believe in fostering an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, leverage their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences.

Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and to creating a welcoming environment for all team members. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status

title: Data Analyst

body:
Newsela is an Instructional Content Platform that brings together engaging, accessible content with integrated assessments and insights to supercharge reading engagement and learning in every subject. We are dedicated to our mission to unlock the written word for everyone. More than five years since our launch, Newsela is already in 90% of schools, across all 50 U.S. states, in addition to being in over 180 countries. The result has been more engaged readers, and engaged readers are better learners.

As Newsela’s usage in classrooms all over the world has grown, so has our focus on using data-driven analysis and results across every area of our business; in turn, this will make us more efficient and effective in helping students learn to read. We’re looking to drive unprecedented gains in student literacy and looking for an analyst to help get us there.

Responsibilities
• Assist the Community Team (Customer Success Team) with building predictive models to help increase engagement and... usage across our customer base
• Create dashboards and deliver insights
• Lead advanced analysis designed to increase operational efficiencies
• Support the senior members of the Data Team in their effort to provide expert analysis to the company
• Design and analyze a variety of A/B tests
• Write SQL queries to extract data, clean and analyze data in Python or R, and prepare presentation

The Ideal Candidate
• Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, including but not limited to mathematics, engineering, computer science, or economics.
• 2+ years in a highly analytical role, including but not limited to business analyst, data analyst, or data scientist working for a company that develops software.
• 1+ years of professional experience using SQL.
• 1+ years of professional experience using a scripting language, including but not limited to Python or R.
• Demonstrated experience retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and presenting and defending analysis.
• Demonstrated experience visualizing analysis (plus for working with high-dimensional data).
• Demonstrated experience explaining technical material to non-technical audiences.

Some Pluses
• Master’s degree in a quantitative field
• Strong statistical and mathematical background
• Experience with any business intelligence tool (e.g. Looker, Chartio, Tableau, etc.)
• Presenting or visualizing insights involving high dimensional data
• Background in Economics
• Extremely detailed oriented.

Newsela is strongly committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all individuals. Newsela will make all employment decisions without unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law
title: Senior Data Analyst

body:
Celmatix is seeking a Clinical Data Analyst to help develop and manage the genetic, biological, and clinical data that powers Reproductive Atlas, our knowledge base about human reproductive potential. You are passionate about using data to improve women's health outcomes and can dive into a new data set to explore and learn how it can be used. You will become an expert on Electronic Medical Record data and through investigation and analysis, determine how to integrate new data sources into Reproductive Atlas. You will work closely with engineering and scientific teams to help make high-quality data available for research and discovery.

Responsibilities:
• Examine and become an internal expert on our partner clinics' Electronic Medical Record data
• Lead the receipt and management of new data transfers from collaborators and partner clinics
• Define transformations to map new data elements to our Celmatix model
• Develop tests and generate reports to ensure quality of Celmatix... clinical data
• Coordinate with teams across Celmatix to implement internal data standards in new data products
• Coordinate with scientific stakeholders to generate data sets for analysis projects by querying Celmatix data
• Coordinate with scientific stakeholders to develop requirements for Celmatix data products

Qualifications:
• Able to use SQL or other query languages to explore and validate data
• Able to use Python, R, or other scripting languages to explore and validate data
• Familiarity with Linux/OS X command line, version control software (git), and general software development best practices
• Bachelor's degree with coursework or major in life sciences or public health (computer science or engineering a plus)
• Experience working with Electronic Medical Records data a plus
• Experience working with healthcare industry standard vocabularies such as SNOMED CT, LOINC, ICD, and RxNorm a plus

About Celmatix

Named one of Fast Company's "50 Most Innovative Companies in 2017," Celmatix is changing the face of women’s health through the development of digital tools and genetic insights focused on fertility potential. Our unique approach combines data science and genomics to bring personalized medicine to fertility. We offer a full range of benefits including excellent medical insurance, pre-tax FSA and transit benefits, parental leave, and a 401k retirement plan.

Celmatix Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate with regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, disability, or veteran status. All are invited to apply
title: Clinical Data Analyst

body:
The core function for this position is to perform analyses and create data visualizations and presentations to support the Custom Advanced Analytics team for both external and internal clients.

The Data Analyst will work on analyses for multi-screen media campaigns utilizing Set-Top-Box tuning data, digital data and various other data sources. The Data Analyst will be responsible for working with various data sets (querying databases utilizing SQL, etc.) to support a4 Media’s business needs and ensuring compliance with deliverable reporting requirements by performing data quality audits and analysis. This position will also be client facing and will require the ability to effectively communicate often complex data analytics to a variety of audiences.

The Analyst will also utilize other Research tools to support various functions within the organization.
• Minimum Undergraduate degree in related discipline (Graduate degree preferred)
• 1-2 Years minimum relevant working experience... preferred but not required
• Analytical and Data Visualization skills. SQL programming, Excel and other Microsoft Office applications required. Python and R programming skills preferred
• Ability to communicate data insights to all levels of external and internal clients and stakeholders
• Team oriented individual
title: Data Analyst

body:
Fluent is a leading performance marketing company with an expertise in delivering measurable results. We interact with 1MM US consumers daily across our owned and operated websites. Our team uses the insights gathered from these interactions to drive growth for our partners. Through engaging digital experiences, Fluent creates meaningful and lasting connections between brands and consumers.
As a Data Analyst, you will use your leadership skills, technology insight, business acumen and creativity as the team builds data pipelines and tools to automate reporting and generate insight. You will use a data driven approach to sharpen decision making and drive understanding of our fast-growing business. In this role, you'll be building scalable solutions that will help make data relevant to Fluent’s Performance Marketing Group on current and historical performance and visualizing the key opportunities for growth. Using your technical skills, you will build tools to automate reporting and... dashboard updates so that Team Leads across Fluent’s different business lines can see quickly and accurately how their businesses are performing.
Responsibilities:
Translate business needs into technical requirements
Build reports, dashboards, models and tools to analyze, report, and present operations related data
Develop Data Warehousing and Reporting solutions to address the growing business reporting, analytics and data requirements
Effective project leadership related to Data Analytics
Brainstorm possible new metrics and/or processes that will lead to revenue growth and/or improved efficiencies
Passion for learning new products and technologies and maintaining a toolkit of skills
Develop own vision and opinions whilst also working as part of a team
Requirements
2-4 years of prior experience required
The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in the development of new Data Automation and Analytical techniques.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience working with statistical and analytic methodologies using R and Python
Experience with databases, including SQL coding across standard commercial databases (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc).
Data Visualization skills
Highly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently, while also able to build strong internal relationships and build consensus on critical initiatives
Ability to learn quickly and work in a constantly changing fast-growing start-up environment
Rigorous yet creative analytic approach that enables superior business outcomes
Benefits
At Fluent, we like what we do and we like who we do it with. Our team is a tight-knit crew of go-getters; we love to celebrate our successes! In addition to two fully-stocked kitchens, catered breakfast and lunch, and free workout classes on site, our office manager keeps the calendar stocked with activity-filled events. When we’re not eating, working out, or planning parties, Fluent folks can be found participating in recreational sports leagues, networking with She Runs It, and bonding with across teams during quarterly outings to baseball games, fancy dinners, and pizza-making classes. And we have all the practical benefits, too…
Competitive salary
Discounted gym memberships
Ample career and professional growth opportunities
Open office space for team collaboration
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401K with generous employer match
The amazing opportunity to work for a high-flying performance marketing company
title: Data Analyst

body:
Reports to: Chief Strategic Initiatives Officer

Overview: CASES is a New York City non-profit organization at the forefront of alternative to incarceration programs and comprehensive services for criminal justice-involved populations. If you are passionate about learning emerging data reporting techniques and take pride in your craft come join our team. CASES’ seeks a Data Analyst for the grants and contract unit. As a lean team of analysts team members are expected to be familiar with core agency data reports. This individual needs to be a conscientious and organized problem solver, with the ability to understand program operations and contract reporting at a high-level. We need a team member willing to roll up their sleeves to build reporting solutions. Our ideal candidate is curious, highly skilled in Excel formulas and able to hustle to meet recurring weekly, monthly, and quarterly deadlines.

Responsibilities: The Data Analyst creates data reports and conducts analysis on the... performance of our programs. The Grants and Contracts team is responsible for data reporting and measurement of program operations for performance-based and cost reimbursement contracts. The Analysts create data reports to generate invoices and large reporting datasets for weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting to government, and private funders, and for agency performance measurement. The Analysts are highly skilled end-users of the Salesforce and AWARDS Foothold Technology databases and government portals and databases. The Analyst will be a thought partner with fiscal, senior program, development, and information services staff.

Specific Responsibilities:

• Develop expertise and advanced competence in a customized Salesforce platform and as needed familiarity and competence with government databases to enter performance data and to extract data for analysis, build and configure large data files for invoicing and reporting
• Learn program contracts and develop data reports to analyze program performance and submit monthly and quarterly data reporting and billing
• Work collaboratively with Program Directors to identify missing, inaccurate, or otherwise problematic data and contribute to oversight procedures to monitor and track the timeliness, accuracy, and usefulness of data
• Extract, format and transform data from agency databases into tables, figures, and charts, and data reports according to program contract management and set protocols for invoicing, financial projection analysis, and performance management
• Develop and present monthly and year-to-date program performance using Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, data visualizations, and provide trend analysis
• Develop and use protocols to identify problems with data entry, datasets and routine extraction processes, rectify issues, and systematize processes for efficient workflows in collaboration with information services and program staff
• Contribute to continuous quality and efficiency improvement to innovate and streamline ways to bring together data for timely, error-free invoicing back-up reports, and performance tracking, and data visualizations in seamless processes
• Review invoice backup data for contracts to ensure the data is reported accurately and that verifiable back-up documentation is available and maintained for audits
• Conduct regular data quality assurance checks to ensure accuracy of data reports produced and of the data in the database, following quality assurance protocols for random peer-to-peer review of analysis conducted by other analysts and reports before distribution internally and to government and funding agencies
• Produce analysis on key program and operational outcomes and drivers that influence year-over-year program performance to enhance agency understanding of underlying program issues, trends and performance to ease the use of data to inform program decision-makers
• Execute queries in databases to extract program datasets for analysis to respond to the needs of senior staff, program staff and external requests from funders, collaborators, policymakers, donors, and other stakeholders
• Communicate clearly and accurately in both verbal and written mode concisely describing problems, solutions, specifications and plans related to data reports
• Provide administrative support as needed—including taking meeting minutes, generating emails with meetings next steps, and following up on action steps
• Participate in program planning efforts by contributing insights about program data, to support the creation of outcomes and plans to track and report on benchmarks
• Manage special assignments that may include analytical support needed to assist in responses for proposals, foundation reports and fundraising
• Perform end user and application support functions including problem solving and resolution of Salesforce application function defects. Provide staff training and support.
• Create and facilitate a welcoming, pleasant and professional work environment to facilitate effective communication and working relationships between departments to support data driven decision-making
• Participate in activities to support new initiatives, stakeholder groups, planning and continuous quality improvement work-plans
• Perform duties in accordance with CASES’ mission, cultural competency, anti-discriminatory and other policies and procedures
• Any other duties as required by the Director and senior staff
title: Data Analyst (Grants & Contracts)

body:
Our client, a leading global bank with one of the largest customer bases abroad and in Asia is seeking a Credit and Data Analyst at their Midtown Manhattan location

title: Credit and Data Analyst

body:
Job Description
Vaco Tampa is hiring! This is a direct hire role in downtown St. Petersburg, FL.

Data Analyst
Qualifications: Bachelor degree in Information Services, Finance or related field, 1-3 years' experience, back office financial operations experience required.
Analyzes securities trading and position data from a wide variety of financial institutions and develops and apply rules to transform and normalize that data to meet the specifications of our clients. The analyst will work closely with our clients to develop and understand their data requirements, set up and maintain data transformation rules and processes, provide status updates and ongoing monitoring and maintenance. The analyst will work closely with colleagues involved with acquiring data and developing data transformation software.
