• Primary Location: United States,New York,New York
• Education: Bachelor's Degree
• Job Function: Trading
• Schedule: Full-time
• Shift: Day Job
• Employee Status: Regular
• Travel Time: No
• Job ID: 19003827

Description

About Citi

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.

Financial Resources Management

The management of capital, liquidity, collateral and balance sheet is a key area of focus for senior management, recognized as being among the most significant challenges currently faced... by the banking sector. As a firm, our ability to effectively lead our businesses in these areas will be a significant determinant of our future competitiveness.

Financial Resources Management (FRM) provides in-business leadership on capital, liquidity and collateral efficiency across the Institutional Clients Group. The team exists to solve complex problems, concentrating on regulatory capital and liquidity optimization opportunities to support the business strategy of the Institutional Clients Group franchise. This broad mandate includes driving business strategy for capital management, advising senior management and clients on implications of regulatory change and strategic priorities, coordinating advocacy efforts, and leading and participating in cross-business and cross-functional working groups to deliver improved data, calculation and management processes related to capital, collateral and liquidity.

In this role you will be part of a fast-paced, team-oriented meritocracy where everyone has a voice. You will be leading a new unit within FRMs Strategic Projects team, focused on data analysis and capital efficiency. Your work will have an immediate and powerful impact. The team's primary focus is developing and executing strategies geared toward optimizing resource efficiency across our Citi Private Bank (CPB), Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS), and Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory (BCMA) businesses by engaging in analytical and advocacy efforts. Key benefits include development of specialized capital knowledge, experience developing and executing complex analytical processes, exposure to senior leadership and multiple products across our ICG group, and working in a rewarding, creative, and dynamic environment.

Key responsibilities include:

• Leading and participating in complex problem solving, providing insights, project analytics and process design, and supporting successful completion of financial resource management projects

• Performing qualitative and quantitative analyses of key Basel III rules and guidelines

• Identifying and explaining technical issues

• Leveraging knowledge and experiences to enrich understanding of similar topics

• Driving the development of financial resource management and optimization solutions

• Partnering with ICG businesses and Risk, Finance, and Technology groups on episodic issues to ensure systems and processes accurately calculate and meaningfully report financial resource metrics

Qualifications

• Bachelor's degree and significant qualifications in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Computer Science, Math, Financial Engineering, Physics or related field

• 5+ years Relevant experience in the Financial Services industry or strategy consulting

• Proven analytical skills for developing data analysis and quantitative strategies

• Ability to query, manage, and perform deep-dives into large scale datasets

• Experience and success with creating, presenting, and delivering an argument to drive progress

• Demonstrated ability to synthesize information into a clear and impactful message

• A demonstrated history of delivering on initiatives by building broad based support, fostering collaboration and driving change; Ability to coordinate processes and work as part of multiple teams across a firm

• An ability to manage personal workload and agenda independently but in alignment with the priorities of the business unit

• An open mind for critical and creative thinking

• Self-motivated, with a strong desire to learn and work independently

• Ability to work under pressure in a highly professional Front Office environment

• Superior attention to detail and level of accuracy

• Excellent communication, interpersonal, organizational and presentational skills
Additionally, the candidate should have an appetite to develop a detailed understanding of the following areas:

• Basel III legislation and regulation

• ICG products and services

• ICG support operations and technology systems architecture
title: FRM Strategic Projects Data Analyst - Vice President | Director

body:
Quantitative Data Analyst

Flatiron Health has built a unified data set that is unparalleled in its depth and accuracy and gives our partners the capability to ask questions about data that weren't answerable until now. Our Quantitative Sciences team answers these questions.

We are looking for team members who are excited to make an immediate impact in a critical space. This position requires outstanding problem-solving, analytical and communication skills; experience with multitasking and prioritizing; and the tenacity to execute against deliverables in a timely, high-quality fashion. You will collaborate with a team of account directors, oncologists, product managers, and software engineers to help develop, commercialize, and deliver our analytics products.

Working in a rapidly expanding business, you will be consistently challenged to partner with Flatiron colleagues to answer important questions in cancer research.

Responsibilities:
• Become a subject matter expert on our data... and its capabilities
• Transform real-world clinical data into actionable insights using robust statistical methods and compelling data visualizations in formats accessible to a wide range of end users
• Work with a cross-functional team to define and clarify analytic requirements, develop analysis plans, ensure data quality standards, and create publication-ready methods and results
• Generate ideas for analyses to shape future projects, contributing to a pipeline of opportunities that will help Flatiron achieve its ambitious growth goals

Requirements:
• You hold a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative discipline, such as biostatistics, epidemiology, applied statistics, or health economics, or equivalent experience
• You have 1-3 years of relevant work experience analyzing real-world clinical data
• You love working with data and have experience exploring data with a critical and thoughtful eye
• You are proficient in a statistical programming language (we primarily use R, but are open to people with experience in any language)
• You are an effective communicator, both oral and written
• You are self-motivated and flexible, thrive in highly uncertain situations, and enjoy coming up with elegant and innovative solutions to challenging problems
• You are a “do-er”-- you know how to balance attention to detail with execution against tight timelines
• You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology
• You are a highly-effective collaborator and are motivated by the opportunity to work with oncologists, software engineers, product managers, and other members of the Flatiron team

Bonus Points:
• Oncology experience
• Consulting experience
• Experience working with longitudinal EMR data
title: Quantitative Data Analyst

body:
Please use the following link to submit your application: https://vigilant.breezy.hr/p/64bff54c91c1-data-analyst-intern?source=angellist

About the internship:

The Data Analyst Intern will join Vigilant’s engineering team to contribute to both technical and business sides of the company. This role is key to our ability to provide increasingly sophisticated data products and expand into new verticals. The person who fills this position will be part of a growing data team within engineering and will handle multiple responsibilities.

The ideal candidate has experience with:

- Building and maintaining end-to-end ETL pipelines, namely:

- Implementing data from a range of sources such as downloadable datasets, API endpoints, massive Excel/CSV files, and non-standardized sources such as PDFs and database dumps

- Transforming, normalizing, cleaning, and mapping extracted data — both at the extraction stage as well as in the destination data warehouse

- Analysis of multivariable datasets... to understand distinctions, whether the datasets encompass each other, and to sort, aggregate or separate the individual datasets as needed

- Conducting analysis of data quality, assurance, coverage, and answering specific business queries as needed

About you:

- You’re a graduate student with real-world data analysis experience or you’re an undergraduate student with at least 3 months experience in a data analysis internship role

- You’ve shown an interest in data analysis through classes you’ve joined, projects you’ve completed, and/or research roles you’ve undertaken

- You are comfortable with ambiguity but strive for clarity in the tasks you undertake

- You have an interest in gaining experience at a tech startup

What you’ll do:

- Implement business intelligence schemas and model statistical datasets

- Debug and improve internal tooling used for data ingestion and analysis

- Manipulate disparate data to construct and implement complex queries

- Develop automation in a dashboard to assess critical business data.

NOTE: This is a great opportunity for someone to learn and gain experience, but it is not a paid position
title: Data Analyst Intern

body:
Since 1851, MassMutual’s commitment has always been to help people protect their families, support their communities, and help one another. This is why we want to inspire people to Live Mutual. We’re people helping people.

A career with us means you will work alongside exceptional people and be empowered to reach your professional and personal goals. Our employees are the foundation of what makes MassMutual a strong, stable and ethical business. We seek and value unique and varied perspectives and experiences because we believe we are stronger when all voices are heard. We invite you to bring your bright, innovative ideas to MassMutual as we continue to help millions of Americans rely on each other.

Together, we’re stronger.

Description

​​

DESCRIPTION

Haven Life is an insuretech innovator at MassMutual that offers a new way to get life insurance online that's actually simple.

We combine the culture of a startup with the stability and backing of a Fortune 500 company to create... an environment that's truly unique.

Our diverse team is comprised of smart, collaborative people who think big, execute quickly and don't take themselves too seriously. We're located in New York's Flatiron District and in case you're wondering, yes, we provide free snacks. Cold brew too.

If you're creative, professional and kind, we'd love to hear from you.

ABOUT THIS ROLE:

We are looking for an individual with an enduring curiosity about data and with an interest in evolving best practices and tools. In collaboration with other team members, you will help shape the vision, planning, and execution of Haven technology and product innovation. You will:
• Partner closely with product managers, engineers, designers, marketing, insurance experts, and other team members to improve customer experience and enhance our business.
• Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing analysis to various business areas within the Haven Life team.
• Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
• Inform, influence, and support product in making data driven decisions.
• Identify data needs and gaps, and work with developers to devise solutions in data gathering, ingestion, and modeling.
• Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources
• Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
• Ad hoc support for key business needs or requests.

REQUIREMENTS
• BS/BA Required
• Minimum 1-3 years' of experience in a Data Analyst role
• Comfortable using BI tools to analyze and manipulate data, such as SQL, Tableau, and Qlik
• Strong skills in data extraction, cleaning, analysis and visualization (e.g. SQL, Python, R)
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Ability to present and communicate findings in a clear manner to a variety of audiences.
• Strong work ethic, intellectual curiosity and attention to detail.

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS
• 3-5 years of experience in a Data Analytics role

BENEFITS

We pay competitive base salaries and we reward performance. Our salary structure is commensurate with experience. In addition, you’ll be eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits program including medical insurance and 401(K).

Qualified applicants must be authorized to work in the US.

Ranked No. 93 in the annual FORTUNE ® 500 Ranking (FORTUNE ® Magazine, June 2018) and recognized as a World’s Most Ethical Company by Ethisphere, MassMutual is guided by a single purpose: We help people secure their future and protect the ones they love. As a company owned by our policyowners, we are defined by mutuality and our vision to put customers first. It’s more than our company structure – it’s our way of life. We are a company of people protecting people. Our company exists because people are willing to share risk and resources, and rely on each other when it counts. At MassMutual, we Live Mutual.

CORE VALUES

Focus on the Customer: We understand our customers well and look for every opportunity to deliver an experience that is clear, easy, personal, human, empowering and trustworthy.

Act with Integrity: We deliver on our promises by being open, honest and humble and by adhering to the letter and spirit of applicable laws, rules, regulations and company policies.

Value People: We respect and learn from each other’s diverse backgrounds, experiences and ideas. We engage and develop people to their greatest potential.

Work Collaboratively: We work together to achieve results by actively listening, seeking, understanding and creating solutions as a unified team driving toward one company, one culture, one brand.

Achieve Results: We focus on winning by exceeding expectations and getting better – everyone, every day.

For more information, visit www.massmutual.com or find us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, Google+, Instagram and Pinterest.

MassMutual is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Individual with Disability/Protected Veteran. We welcome all persons to apply. Note: Veterans are welcome to apply, regardless of their discharge status
title: Data Analyst

body:
Lead Financial Data Analyst

04-Mar-2019

Role/Responsibilities

Financial Data Analysts have a significant input to the ratings and research process by analyzing financial statements and data provided by Issuers.
• The FDA uses accounting and finance knowledge and judgment to perform financial statement analysis, adjust reported data per relevant methodology requirements and review and analyze ratios
• Responsible for reviewing and understanding financial statements, official statements and other documents related to issuers’ performance
• Work directly with ratings and support analysts to explain the data, adjustments and other information needed by the rating team for ratings and research
• Frequently liaise with analysts and accounting specialists in order to understand the application of accounting concepts on a particular entity
• Create documentation and provide guidance to support analysts and outsourcers
• Review, adjust and publish data to external market participants
•... Regularly interact with Moody's ratings analysts regarding financial and operational data needed for analysis and publications
• In addition to regular daily responsibilities, FDAs will have the opportunity to work on new projects such as technology projects, accounting changes, analytic reviews, methodology updates and implementation of process improvements
• The team is regularly provided with valuable training classes and interaction with Analysts as part of knowledge transfer and career growth

The FDA position provides a unique opportunity to foster skills that are valuable to any future career in the financial services industry.

Job Req ID

14673BR

Line of Business

ODC (ODC)

Securities Trading Policy (STP)

Candidates for Moody's Corporation may be asked to disclose securities holdings pursuant to Moody’s Policy for Securities Trading and the requirements of the position. Employment is contingent upon compliance with the Policy, including remediation of positions in those holdings as necessary.

Entity

Moody's Investors Service (MIS)

Posting Title

Financial Data Analyst

EEO Policy

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com.. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For San Francisco positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. For New York City positions, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of the New York City Fair Chance Act. For all other applicants, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment consistent with the requirements of applicable law.

Click here to view our full EEO policy statement. Click here for more information on your EEO rights under the law.

City

New York

Required Qualifications
• B.A. or B.S. degree required
• 1-3 years of relevant work experience required (can include internship experience).
• Knowledge or prior experience in analyzing financial statements is required
• Individual must be organized, dependable, able to multi-task and manage priorities, display initiative, and have the ability to work independently in a demanding, fast-paced environment
• Strong organizational, communication (verbal & written), and interpersonal skills are required
• Candidate must have the ability to quickly transition as priorities change to meet demands

Regular/Temporary

Regular

Working at Moody's

Moody's is an essential component of the global capital markets, providing credit ratings, research, tools and analysis that contribute to transparent and integrated financial markets. Moody's Corporation (NYSE: MCO) is the parent company of Moody's Investors Service, which provides credit ratings and research covering debt instruments and securities, and Moody's Analytics, which offers leading-edge software, advisory services and research for credit and economic analysis and financial risk management. The Corporation, which reported revenue of $4.2 billion in 2017, employs approximately 11,900 people worldwide and maintains a presence in 41 countries. Further information is available at www.moodys.com.

LOB/Department

Operations & Data Controls, CFG

Experience Level

Entry Level

Job Category

Credit Analysis & Research

Job Sub Category

Credit Rating Analysts

MIS Culture of Excellence

At MIS, our workplace culture supports our mission to be the Agency of Choice for our customers, employees and future employees. Our Culture focuses on Excellence and embodies behavioral qualities such as Integrity, Responsiveness, Collaboration, Respect and Passion. Our people are our core asset and we look beyond outcomes to ensure that behaviors and interactions matter.

Preferred Qualifications
• Major specializations in Accounting, Finance, or Economics preferred
• Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office products and particularly Excel, such as pivot tables, lookups, etc.
• Knowledge or prior experience in accounting is a plus

Entity

Moody’s Investors Service is among the world’s most respected and widely utilized sources for credit ratings and research. Our opinions and analysis on a broad range of credit obligors and obligations are valued around the world for their insight and rigor
title: Financial Data Analyst

body:
Compass is a technology-driven real estate platform that provides comprehensive brokerage services, combining exceptional agents with thoughtfully crafted digital products to make the process of buying, selling, or renting a home intelligent, deliberate, and seamless.

As a Data Analyst of the Data Intelligence Team, you will work with a group of data engineers, data scientists, and analysts in building the Compass data platform. As an expert in data and analytics, you will be responsible for working with product teams to measure the impact, uncover insights, and drive product decisions.

The Data Intelligence team’s mission is to envision, build and deploy the next generation end-to-end platform for data ingestion, processing, storage, scheduling and analysis at massive scale to provide leverage for Compass. Every team at Compass—product, engineering, operations, product experts, people and culture and leadership rely on our platform to make data-informed decisions as well as power... the business with data.

At Compass You Will
• Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define success metrics, develop mechanisms to track the data, and ensure all teams can use data to make decisions
• Work closely with data engineers to build a data pipeline that prepares aggregated results for dashboards using SQL
• Explore our data through user segmentation, cohort analysis, funnels, regression models, etc. to drive a better shared understanding of user behavior
• Create views and models in Looker using LookML
• Lead the development and maintenance of company-wide dashboards and visualizations that influence product strategy
• Champion and build a culture of data informed decision making

What We Look For
• Bachelor's degree in an analytical field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or related field)
• 3+ years experience in a quantitative analysis role
• Experience developing, troubleshooting, and optimizing SQL queries, ETL jobs, and data pipelines in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets
• Experience with Business intelligence tools such as Looker or Tableau is a plus
• Be self-driven, and show the ability to deliver on ambiguous projects
• Familiarity with statistical packages such as R, SAS, SPSS; experience with a scripting language such as Python is a plus but not required
• Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasks with a proven ability to meet hard deadlines
• Strong communication skills, particularly in relation to data presentation

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone’s place

We also believe that diversity is essential to building an environment where everyone can feel they belong. We’re continuously building an inclusive company where everyone feels welcome and heard. Come join our rapidly growing team!

title: DATA ANALYST

body:
Data is integral to nearly everything that we do at AbleTo, and as a result the analytics team plays a key role at our company. You should be excited to work with data, have the curiosity to dive deeply into issues, and feel empowered to make a meaningful impact at a mission-driven company. You will be a critical business partner to operational leaders at AbleTo, helping them identify gaps in existing workflows, as well as opportunities to improve operational procedures. This role will be the face of the data team for our clinical operations and call center business units.

Technical Leadership
• Work with business leaders to define key business questions and apply analytical rigor to decision-making process
• Develop business intelligence tools to further support analytics self service offering
• Design, develop, and maintain metrics, reports, and dashboards to drive key business decisions

Stakeholder Management
• Develop an understanding of each business unit’s needs and deliver... actionable recommendations to address those needs
• Inform clinical operations and call center strategies in a fast moving agile environment
• Coordinate with product and engineering teams to ensure capture of key data points

Example projects include:
• Assisting with development of tools to monitor capacity of our clinical network
• Collaborating with data science team to identify factors that lead to highest engagement rates within call center
• Creating reports for major clients highlighting impact of our program on their members

Qualifications
• BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Operations Research, or other related discipline
• Experience in Healthcare industry preferred
• Experience with independently breaking down large projects into actionable steps
• 2-4 years relevant work experience
• 1+ years managing stakeholder relationships
• 2+ years using data to make product or operational insights
• 2+ years identifying KPIs and building reporting capabilities
• Self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills

Competencies:
• Strong proficiency with SQL
• Strong familiarity with BI tools such as Looker (preferred) or Tableau
• Experience with Python
• Experience working on GCP and/or AWS platforms is a plus

AbleTo is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. AbleTo is an E-Verify company.

Upon the acceptance of an offer to enter into this agreement, AbleTo requires the satisfactory completion of reference and background checks and successful completion of drug testing in accordance with local, state and federal laws
title: Healthcare Data Analyst

body:
More than 30 years ago, E*TRADE pioneered the online brokerage industry by executing the first-ever electronic individual investor trade. While the landscape of our industry has changed dramatically, our culture of innovation and drive to make online trading accessible to everyone continues to drive us forward. We believe in challenging the status quo, fostering an environment of curiosity and learning, and, above all, putting our customers first.

The role is part of the Analytics and Decision Sciences team. You will join a team of ambitious and passionate associates, driven by ideas and with a bias towards execution. We look for associates willing to think beyond traditional organizational structures and with a strong desire to experiment, build and learn as well as grow personally and professionally.

As a Lead Business Analyst, you will work on programs and projects from start to end and deliver high-quality data solutions to grow E*TRADE. You will partner with various... stakeholders to design and develop data driven insights that inform business and product decisions. Additionally, you will be responsible for identifying, researching, and resolving complex technical problems that enhance E*TRADE's business decision making capabilities. Your technical skills, business acumen, and creativity will be essential as you build tools to automate reporting and generate timely business insights.
• Collect and analyze data to support business partners, working closely with finance, product and operational leaders to understand their analytical needs and deliver rigorous analysis to drive business results
• Leverage technology and critical thinking skills to continually innovate and automate existing methodologies, processes and reporting.
Design, develop, test, and implement new approaches.
• Partner with Engineering teams to operationalize / scale data solutions to improve E*TRADE’s business intelligence and analytical platforms, such as querying, reporting and analytical tools
• Leverage SQL, Tableau, and other analytic platforms to gather, clean, and prepare data; create dashboards/reports; develop KPIs; analyze trends; provide insights
Integrate new tools, software, and technology to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and improve working methods and culture within the analytics team
• Play an active role in our team’s leadership team, taking initiative to execute on our mission, prioritize work, make tradeoffs, manage conflicts and constantly push the team to grow and evolve

Basic qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in analytical, quantitative or STEM field
• 4+ years of relevant experience in the following:
• Data manipulation using SQL and other scripting languages development (advanced/expert level)
• Familiarity with analytics methods/theory (statistics, ML, etc.)
• 3+ years of experience building and creating dashboards for business consumption, including synthesizing data in graphical format
• 1+ years of analytical programs/tools (e.g., SAS, R, Python, etc.)

Preferred qualifications:
• Experience working in high data volume environments
• Excellent communication and relationship skills, especially ability to manage relationships with executive level stakeholders
• Experience with analytics projects, including modeling, tuning and productionizing solutions
• 3+ years of working with statistical and analytical programs/tools such as SAS, R, Python
• 2+ years of developing solutions using data tools (Hive, Hadoop, etc.)
• 3+ year experience in designing and delivering data warehousing, business intelligence, and reporting solutions
• Ability to thrive in environments with multiple cross functional stakeholders with competing agendas by bringing people together to achieve a common goal
• Excellent stakeholder management skills including expectation setting, education, conflict management, prioritization, etc.
• High level of autonomy and initiative
• Experience in Finance or Financial Analysis

We offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please visit https://www.etradecareers.com/why-work-at-etrade/employee-benefits/ to learn more about the opportunities.

E*TRADE Financial is an Equal Opportunity Employer who encourages diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, disability, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law
title: Lead Data Analyst

body:
Bronx RHIO's Informatics Center provides analysis and reporting services to over 25 member organizations, using the data from more than 60 member organizations' electronic medical record and claims data. The Data Analyst will develop, maintain, and support data tools and reports for RHIO projects. Data products will incorporate a variety of data elements from numerous contributing sources, and requires the ability to integrate and align disparate types of data into a unified output. The software tools used to do this work include python, related libraries used with python and the proprietary query language of our vender, IMAT. The overall purpose of the analyst's work is to take extremely complex data normalization processes, queries and analysis tasks and provide a cogent and user friendly output to the RHIO's end users.

Education/Skills :

Bachelor's Degree required. Three years experience.

Knowledge of Python and/or R software language.

- Experience working with large data sets... (millions of rows), includes EMR, claims and other

- Strong knowledge of informatics principles and techniques, with a focus on healthcare/clinical/public health applications including public health and population health surveillance uses of data.

- Strong coding skills for data analysis. Python preferred; R is also acceptable. FHIR API knowledge preferred. Some SQL helpful

- Understanding of database principles. Experience with NoSQL databases would be helpful.

- Experience working with healthcare quality metrics and/or value based payment metrics

-Experience operationalizing specifications against live data.

-Experience working in healthcare setting or with health care work flow and data use

-Familiarity with health information exchange concepts and related federal standards and regulations (TEFCA)

-Data visualization concepts and tools (e.g. javascript) preferred

- Knowledge of clinical coding systems (ICD-10, CPT, HCPCS, Snomed, LOINC, medication coding systems)

title: DATA ANALYST PROGRAMMER

body:
About Trialspark
Today, the biggest bottleneck in bringing new treatments to patients is the clinical trial. On average, getting a drug through the trial process takes nearly a decade and frequently costs $100M+. And the problem is only getting worse.
At TrialSpark, we don’t believe it has to be this way. Through technology and a new operational model, we’re reimaging how clinical trials are run, with the mission of bringing new treatments to patients faster.
We do this by partnering with physicians to enable them to run clinical trials within their existing practices. By providing the technology platform, equipment, and staffing,TrialSpark alleviates the operational burden of clinical research, enabling physicians to focus on what they do best -- patient care. And by bringing clinical research to physician practices, TrialSpark is enabling access for the 98% of patients who are never exposed to clinical trial opportunities.
About the role
Delivering a clinical trial across multiple... trial sites is a highly complex endeavor, involving lots of different people, processes, and logistics. And running numerous clinical trials at once, across a nationwide site network, increases the complexity of the problem exponentially.
As a Senior Operations Analyst, your focus will be helping us to manage this complexity. You will be responsible for developing a deep, data-driven understanding of our operational model and identifying the key leverage points to drive greater efficiency. You’ll map out the exact activities required to deliver a clinical trial and locate opportunities to reduce time and cost. Example questions you’ll help us answer include:
How many people do we need to staff a clinical trial? What are the primary drivers of the size and makeup of the team? Given the needs of the trial and the workloads, capabilities, and geographical locations of the various team members, who should be included in the team?
What does it cost to run a clinical trial? What are the major drivers of these costs and what improvements can we make to the model to drive efficiency? Where do we build vs. buy software?
In what ways can we optimize our physical trial operations? Can we better route our staff and resources between sites? What does an efficient clinical logistics network look like?
Based on the forecasted growth of the business, how many people do we need to hire for each role, and by when?
About you
This is a core operational role for TrialSpark, We’re looking for highly talented candidates with an extensive background in analytical problem solving. Candidates for this role should be able to take complex, open-ended problems and develop structured, data-driven solutions.
An ideal candidate:
You have a deep analytical background with experience in an Operational science or research capacity, and are passionate about breaking down and understanding complex systems end-to-end. Prior experience could include data science, operations, consulting, or finance.
You have strong technical chops — you’ve lived in Excel, can write SELECT statements in your sleep, and can Python or R your way in and out of any situation.
You are excited about working cross-functionally with operations, finance, product, engineering, and data to develop innovative solutions to challenging operational problems.
You are proactive, strategic, implementation-focused, and ready to roll up your sleeves and make an impact right away
You are low ego, collaborative, and a fast-learner
You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status
title: Senior Data Analyst

body:
Loeb Enterprises is a New York based business development lab and private investor, focused on cultivating opportunities in emerging media and consumer marketing. Loeb Enterprises, led by entrepreneur and highly successful CEO Michael Loeb, maintains a team of world-class operators, direct marketing executives and technologists that apply themselves to a select number of strategically important businesses each year. These companies vary by stage—from pure start-ups to mature businesses in need of reinvention—but are alike in that they leverage Loeb’s proven blend of business vision and operational skills toward superior value creation.

The analytics team works across a diverse range of businesses to help determine and implement a data-driven strategy. In some cases, this could mean establishing and tracking financial KPIs. In others, it could mean segmenting and optimizing marketing campaigns. In others still, it may involve building data pipelines and integrating data science into... products. We are a highly collaborative team that enjoys turning data into insights and ultimately business value.

Business Analysts on our team are a sort of hybrid data analyst / project manager. They understand the strengths and weaknesses of our datasets because they holistically understand the business’ immediate and long-term goals. They work closely with our partners to simultaneously empower decision makers to move more quickly with greater information, and to enable development of a data-driven culture as the business grows. Within the analytics team, they collaborate with our data engineers and data scientists by identifying opportunities to provide highly-leverageable support and ensure that those projects stay in-line with the business’ broader strategy.
• Develop visualizations and dashboards for a broad range of end users
• Present strategic insights and actionable recommendations
• Ensure data and analytics projects meet client objectives
• Define and evaluate KPIs across various campaigns and tests
• Create predictive models to forecast patterns in consumer behavior
• Coordinate with various teams to develop BI systems and minimize complexity
• Use SQL queries to dig deep into data
• Verify accuracy and find outliers
• Organize, maintain, and enhance reporting systems
• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
• Highly organized- experience with project management software (ie Trello, Asana, JIRA, etc)
• Data visualization
• Tableau
• Excel
• SQL

title: Data Analyst/ Data Lineage

body:
DATA ANALYST Job Description
Day to Day Responsibilities: -
- Drive new product on-boarding onto the existing platform. Understand business requirements, interact with upstream source systems, perform data analysis, derive ETL mappings and customize the existing functionalities

- Analyze trading and settlement data from various Client sources: front end trading systems, and historical databases. Reconcile source data to various Exchange, Broker, banks reports and invoices.

- Perform data validation, conversion and massaging to Strategic Platform's format. Ensure data quality and accuracy. Write sql queries for different source databases by interpreting their data models

- Map the data from external sources to Strategic platform. Create and maintain the Strategic platform's data standards. Identify data exception conditions.

- Analyze data requirements and design data models in both OLTP and OLAP using ERD and dimensional modeling. Translate business requirements into data... fields.

- Meet with subject matter experts from the business line to determine reporting requirements

- Analyze the impact of requirements changes on existing system and there by effect the changes

- Perform development, user acceptance testing and production checkouts. Support development and testing cycles and manage UAT.

Essential Skills Required: -
- In depth financial product knowledge : Equity, Fixed Income (Treasury, Bonds etc), Derivatives (Futures, Options, Swaps, Interest Rate Products, Equity, Credit etc ), Foreign Exchange, Commodities etc

- Data Architect in both OLTP/OLAP environments including data modeling, dimensional modeling, Data Mapping, ETL Design/Transformation and Metadata repository. Familiarity with Data Modeling Tools such as Erwin, ERStudio, or System Designer

- SQL skills and an understanding of a RDBM System (Sybase- RapidSQL Or Oracle- PLSQL)

- Working knowledge of UNIX, Linux - experience in writing simple commands.

- Candidate should have 12+ years of experience in the financial services industry with a minimum of 8 years supporting Investment Banking IT projects in a major investment bank. Candidate should possess knowledge of transaction mechanics and market structure for all major product classes and instrument types: fixed income, treasury products, listed and OTC derivatives, and equity.

- Experience with data warehousing and reporting projects is a plus.

Please see our complete list of jobs at: www.rmscorp.com
title: Data Analyst - Investment Banking

body:
Fluent is a leading performance marketing company with an expertise in delivering measurable results. We interact with 1MM US consumers daily across our owned and operated websites. Our team uses the insights gathered from these interactions to drive growth for our partners. Through engaging digital experiences, Fluent creates meaningful and lasting connections between brands and consumers.
As a Data Analyst, you will use your leadership skills, technology insight, business acumen and creativity as the team builds data pipelines and tools to automate reporting and generate insight. You will use a data driven approach to sharpen decision making and drive understanding of our fast-growing business. In this role, you'll be building scalable solutions that will help make data relevant to Fluent’s Enterprise Solutions Group on current and historical performance and visualizing the key opportunities for growth. Using your technical skills, you will build tools to automate reporting and... dashboard updates so that Team Leads across Fluent’s different business lines can see quickly and accurately how their businesses are performing.
Responsibilities:
Translate business needs into technical requirements
Build reports, dashboards, models and tools to analyze, report, and present operations related data
Develop Data Warehousing and Reporting solutions to address the growing business reporting, analytics and data requirements
Effective project leadership related to Data Analytics
Brainstorm possible new metrics and/or processes that will lead to revenue growth and/or improved efficiencies
Passion for learning new products and technologies and maintaining a toolkit of skills
Develop own vision and opinions whilst also working as part of a team
Requirements
2-4 years of prior experience required
The ideal candidate will have a keen interest in the development of new Data Automation and Analytical techniques.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience working with statistical and analytic methodologies using R and Python
Experience with databases, including SQL coding across standard commercial databases (e.g. Oracle, Teradata, MySQL, etc).
Data Visualization skills
Foundational Attributes:
Exhibits intellect and curiosity; is rigorously committed to personal learning and improvement
Displays strong emotional intelligence in order to read and adapt to the situation at hand and adjust approach
Demonstrates a methodical and meticulous approach to preparation and execution
Highly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently, while also able to build strong internal relationships and build consensus on critical initiatives
Ability to learn quickly and work in a constantly changing fast-growing start-up environment
Rigorous yet creative analytic approach that enables superior business outcomes
Benefits
At Fluent, we like what we do and we like who we do it with. Our team is a tight-knit crew of go-getters; we love to celebrate our successes! In addition to two fully-stocked kitchens, catered breakfast and lunch, and free workout classes on site, our office manager keeps the calendar stocked with activity-filled events. When we’re not eating, working out, or planning parties, Fluent folks can be found participating in recreational sports leagues, networking with She Runs It, and bonding with across teams during quarterly outings to baseball games, fancy dinners, and pizza-making classes. And we have all the practical benefits, too…
Competitive salary
Discounted gym memberships
Ample career and professional growth opportunities
Open office space for team collaboration
Health, dental, and vision insurance
401K with generous employer match
The amazing opportunity to work for a high-flying performance marketing company
title: Data Analyst - Performance Analytics

body:
If you are a Senior Healthcare Data Analyst with experience, please read on!

Top Reasons to Work with Us

We are an international healthcare consultancy specializing in end to end evidence development, optimization, and communication.

The company's core competencies reside in Meta Research, Modeling, Data Analytics, Scientific Writing and Simulation & Risk Analytics. Senior Management has over 50 years of life sciences experience working in pharma, medical device, consulting, and academia.

Through our integrated capabilities in data analytics, epidemiology, health economics, market access and medical communications, we provide our clients with a competitive edge in this dynamic market environment.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be coding and doing data analysis within the healthcare industry. This includes predictive analytics, risk analytics, and data modeling.

Responsibilities
• Report directory to the group Director, working in teams to conduct real world data analyses for... pharmaceutical, medical device and biotechnology clients.
• Lead the design and execution of real world data analyses including development of statistical analysis plans (SAP)
• Lead more junior analysts in the execution of project work
• Synthesize study results and translate into key findings, interpret results in the context of product/market/industry dynamics, and communicate results to clients.
• Independently develop high-quality client deliverables in a timely manner
• Collaborate with Client Leads and junior analysts, including regular participation in knowledge sharing, training and mentorship activities
What You Need for this Position

Must Have
• MS or greater in related field
• 3+ years of Data Analysis/Data science experience
• 3+ years of experience analyzing healthcare data and EMR Claims Data
• Strong SAS and R coding skills
• Health-care/Life Science industry experience
Nice To Have
• Visualization techniques/tools such as Tableau, Spotfire, and R
• Advanced statistical modeling techniques
What's In It for You
• Competitive Salary DOE
• 401(k) with match
• Generous PTO
• Comprehensive Benefits package
So, if you are a Senior Healthcare Data Analyst with experience, please apply today!

body:
Huxley Associates is supporting a global financial market company in the heart of Midtown Manhattan. They are a market intelligence & price information service delivering independent OTC data for realtime, end-of-day and historical products. Their data covers the transaction lifecycle and allows clients to execute efficiently. There are over 400 million updates per day and constant advances in their product sophistication. We provide the intelligence behind algorithmic trading, research models, risk and compliance applications, and portfolio pricing and management.

Job Details:
• Define and Implement data monitoring required by different data products

• Liaise with Ops/QA/Market data regional teams in London, New York and Singapore

title: Data Analyst - Financial Markets - Contract

body:
WHAT WE DO MATTERS:

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. In 15 countries around the world, our leading family of brands (The Knot, WeddingWire, Bodas, GigMasters, The Bump, How They Asked, Lasting, and more) inspire, inform, and celebrate our communities as they move through life’s milestones. From the proposal to creating a home, and starting a family together, we’re there for every step of the journey. Our couples and business partners depend on us. They're all in. So are we.

ABOUT THE ROLE:

This Data Analyst will work with stakeholders within the marketing department of TKWW. They will help the client understand performance of our acquisition channels and conversion funnels.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Analyze TKWW user behavior and identify growth opportunities to drive acquisition and engagement
• Create and manage dashboards in dashboarding tools like Qlik, Birst and Tableau, Google Sheets, Google Data Studio, Excel and develop presentations to keep the... team apprised of key trends
• Communicate, collaborate and present results to clients within TKWW
• Explore novel ways to look at our data

SUCCESSFUL DATA ANALYST CANDIDATES HAVE:
• Background working within a marketing team in a data-driven environment
• SQL and database experience
• Experience with Google Analytics and BigQuery
• Front-end Qlik, Birst or Tableau dashboard development
• 2-3 years of hands-on web analytics or business intelligence
• Commitment to timelines, accuracy, and professionalism
• Ability to work in a fast paced environment and shift gears quickly
• Excellent communication and project management skills
• You have a Bachelor or Master's Degree
• Proficiency with R or Python a plus

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:
• You deeply understand our users and put them at the center of everything you do. You aim to serve and delight them every day.
• You are respectful and act with the highest integrity. If you see something that isn’t right, you say something.
• You ask questions to understand a perspective and are comfortable respectfully challenging assumptions. You are not turned off by constructive conflict to get to the right answer.
• You set clear ambitious goals. You anticipate obstacles, persevere, and are accountable for your commitments.
• You aren’t afraid to challenge the status quo and know that there’s no such thing as failure if you learn from it.
• You seek out feedback and never settle in your quest to grow and develop. By being here, you make our company stronger.

WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:

The Knot Worldwide offers a unique employee experience and we are deeply proud of our award-winning culture. From flexible vacation and generous parental leave benefits to promoting wellness and giving back to our community, we believe in happiness above all else—in and out of the office.

----

The Knot Worldwide provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, or disability. In addition to federal law requirements, The Knot Worldwide complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. The Knot Worldwide expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

----

This position is not eligible for sponsorship
title: Data Analyst

body:
Discover your opportunity with
Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 5th largest financial group in the
world (as ranked by S&P Global, April 2018) with total assets of over $2.9
trillion (106.2 (JPY) as of March 30, 2018) and 150,000 colleagues in more than
50 countries. In the U.S., we're 13,000 strong, working together to positively
impact every customer, organization, and community we serve. We achieve this by
delivering on our values, putting people first, fostering long-term
relationships built on honesty and mutual understanding, and inspiring the best
in each other. This is all part of our inclusive, high-performing culture
supported by Total Rewards that include our cash balance pension plan. Join a
team that's working to fulfill its vision to be the world's most trusted
financial group.

communication, data analysis and documentation

expertise within report content

process

and risk areas in support of detail current state analysis activities

to work

Reconciliations and validations. Identify data thresholds, as an example. This

not work with

title: Sr. Data Analyst,Vice President

body:
The role of a Production data analyst is to assists our clients in the execution of promotional campaigns by utilizing a methodology that is both strategical and results oriented. The PDA will work with our internal support teams to ensure they understand the client’s business needs and campaign strategy. Based on these requirements, the PDA will develop efficient programs, build business processes, and introduce automation around campaign execution. The PDA will collaborate and work with other members of the Solutions Development team, Campaign Operations and Client Services.

Essential Responsibilities
• Fully understands details of the client's data, ensuring our clients receive accurately segmented, cleansed, formatted and ready-to-market data.
• Experience in credit bureau data and processing requirements.
• Researches, trouble shoots, administers application administration, conducts application user training.
• Provides data analysis and recommendations to support multiple... technical operations and ensure client satisfaction.
• Executes and analyzes decision support processes and data to measure campaign efficiency, data accuracy, data integrity, operations performance, customer satisfaction and cost effectiveness.
• Manage and execute multiple level complex campaigns of various types, which may include, but is not limited to, the review of campaign specifications, working with clients to validate and obtain sign-off of client deliverables and dynamic campaign execution.
• Manage, execute and analyze decision support processes and data to measure campaign efficiency, data accuracy, data integrity, operations performance, customer satisfaction, and cost effectiveness.
• Build and implement reporting solutions utilizing various reporting tools which may include ad hoc and/or automated delivery/distribution.
• Develop and execute repeatable processes via SQL Server Stored Procedures and SSDT Package Flows.
• Drive, develop, maintain and improve client relationship through increased client communications.

Desired Characteristics
• Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Management Information Systems or 5-years’ experience SDLC with an emphasis on a RDBMS discipline.
• RDBMS experience with databases such as MS SQL Server utilities such as SSDT, SSRS, and SSIS, Oracle, My Sql, Vertica.
• Data Modeling and Normalization
• Ability to write, debug, and troubleshoot Stored Procedures, Packages, and functions.
• FTP processing and best practices
• Exposure with ETL processes and tools such as DMExpress and Talend.
• Analytical mindset, solutions oriented, ability to think outside of the box and problem solve.
• Ability to work independently but also able to contribute in a team setting.

#LI-MC1

Company Summary

Zeta is a data-driven marketing technology innovator whose SaaS-based marketing cloud helps 500+ Fortune 1000 and Middle Market brands acquire, retain and grow customer relationships through actionable data, advanced analytics and machine learning.

Founded by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley (former CEO of Apple and Pepsi-Cola) in 2007, the company's highly-rated ZetaHub technology platform has been recognized in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Digital Marketing Hubs (February 2017) and in its Magic Quadrant for Multichannel Campaign Management (April 2017), competing with offerings from Oracle, IBM, Salesforce and Adobe.

Operating on four continents with 1,300+ employees, the company is headquartered in New York City, with Centers of Excellence in Silicon Valley, Boston, London, and Hyderabad, India.

Zeta Global is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ancestry, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, medical condition, disability, veteran’s status, or any other basis protected by law.

Recent News

Zeta Global Recognized by The Relevancy Group as Industry Leader for the 4th Consecutive Year

Zeta Global is Recognized as a Visionary by Gartner for the First Time
title: Production Data Analyst

body:
Lead Marketing Data Analysts (MDAs) on Product Strategy are the backbone of development and production of Crossix’s beachhead product DIFA™, the leading platform for measuring and optimizing digital and TV healthcare marketing. LMDAs will manage the day to day production of DIFA deliverables as well as use their engineering mindset to help the team find solutions to make DIFA more scalable and automated. LMDAs will be at the heart of R&D for new innovative product features using breadth of health and consumer data.
What You'll Do
Leverage cutting-edge technology and analytics capabilities to help healthcare clients plan, measure and optimize digital and TV marketing campaigns
Produce and manage the delivery of weekly production for Crossix DIFA™, the leading platform for measuring and optimizing digital and TV healthcare marketing, across portfolio of clients
Build expertise in analytics related to digital and TV marketing initiatives and be the go-to person for data and methodology... related questions
Utilize Crossix technology to link marketing exposures to transactional data
Execute project requirements, using a logic-based proprietary language alongside python, SQL, Excel, and other analytics and data visualization tools
Independently troubleshoot data anomalies and inconsistencies
Identify, plan, develop, and test new processes to improve scale and automation of DIFA production
Identify and communicate areas for improvement within the current production process
Define specs to work alongside Analytics Product team to find solutions and develop new features that will help with automation and scale
Test new production process and confirm improvements in automation and scale without impacting result
Research and develop new innovative product features and advanced analytics to enhance DIFA
Work with senior members on rollout plan and execute on the release of new product features to clients
Research and understand how to leverage breadth of health and consumer data which can be incorporated into DIFA as a new metric based on client feedback
Develop the feature in a way that is scalable, automated, and seamlessly be incorporated into current production process
Document and present methodology, result, and how clients can use this new feature to make key optimization decisions to key internal stakeholders and client services team
What You've Done
1-3 years relevant experience
Quantitative interest, demonstrated through coursework or professional experience
Interest in the power of “Big Data”
“Can-do” attitude and approach
Entrepreneurial self-starter and team player
4-year college degree with strong academic performance
Exposure to marketing and/or healthcare a plus
Python, SQL and database experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Engineering mindset
About the Team – Crossix delivers hard-to-come-by insights that enable healthcare marketers to plan, measure, and optimize their marketing campaigns with confidence. Using our own proprietary technology and network of health and non-health data, our analyses pinpoint the tactics, programs, and channels that improve performance and boost sales, enabling better healthcare communications. And we do it all while protecting consumer privacy.
Leadership – With decades of combined experience and an unrivaled track record of healthcare innovation, our leadership team sets the standard for us. Their knowledge and expertise continually challenge us and the industry – through their work, their speaking engagements at conferences and their thought leadership published in the top industry publications.
Culture – We know that our employees set us apart. Along with competitive salaries and benefits, we invest in creating compelling opportunities for professional development and career growth. We also believe that diversity is essential to building an environment where everyone can feel they belong. We’re continuously building an inclusive company where everyone feels welcome and heard. Come join our rapidly growing team!
We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, ancestry, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or veteran status

title: Data Analyst – Banking / Financial Services with Xiar

body:
Compass is expanding in technology and geographic reach and looking for a Data Analyst. The ideal person will have the opportunity to impact one of the biggest decisions that every single consumer across the world must make -- where to live.

In particular, our Data Analyst will oversee all of the real estate and other related information underlying every one of our consumer-facing products and the proprietary tools that are part of our Compass Agent productivity applications.

At Compass You Will:
• Support product feature teams by building and maintaining dashboards and visualizations that drive actionable insights
• Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define and measure the right KPIs for each feature team and ensure those KPIs are well communicated across the organization
• Conduct exploratory analysis to inform product strategy and evaluate recent product releases
• Explore our data through user segmentation, cohort analysis, funnels, regression models, etc. to... drive a better shared understanding of user behavior
• Create views and models in Looker using LookML
• Partner with engineering and business intelligence teams to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging and metrics
• Implement our Data Design standards and advocate them throughout the org

What We Look For:
• Bachelor's degree in an analytical field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics or related field)
• 2+ years experience in a quantitative analysis role
• Has worked with large datasets and is capable of summarizing key findings to appropriate stakeholders. Ability to build clear, easy to understand dashboards that capture the right metrics is a must
• Very comfortable with SQL and Excel. Experience with Business intelligence tools such as Looker or Tableau is a plus
• Proficiency with statistical packages such as R, SAS, SPSS; experience with a scripting language such as Python is a plus
• Predictive modeling experience and experience with A/B testing frameworks is a plus
• Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize diverse tasks with a proven ability to meet hard deadlines
• Strong communication skills, particularly in relation to data presentation

At Compass, our mission is to help everyone find their place in the world. This means we continually celebrate the diverse community different individuals cultivate. As an equal opportunity employer, we stay true to our mission by ensuring that our place can be anyone’s place

title: Data Analyst

body:
Bloomberg runs on data and technology. In Global Data, we’re responsible for on-boarding, analyzing, applying and supplying it to help answer our clients’ questions. We manage data and workflow processes on the Bloomberg Terminal to help our clients solve problems such as how to measure the risk of monsoons in Vietnam, so clients looking to invest in agriculture there can make more informed decisions; or how to measure the real wealth of people in Venezuela, for clients who want to open stores in South America. We analyze data so our teams can turn it into insights for our users.
What's the role?

You’ll launch your career in the Global Data Training Program. You will receive both classroom and on the job training to put you on a path to leverage your technical acumen and intellectual curiosity. After training, you’ll play a key role in producing financial content, algorithms, research notes and analyses for our clients while also inspiring news content that empowers our clients to... make the right decisions. Market Data Analysts also provide unparalleled customer service and work to solve complex issues, while establishing relationships with key market players in the financial industry.
You can expect to:
• Research various content sets to find applicable data for our products
• Utilize domain expertise to format data and maintain data quality standards
• Apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow improvements
• Respond to client queries
• Learn our workflows and technology, while expanding upon your financial market knowledge
• Collaborate with other data teams, Engineering, Product Management, News and Bloomberg Intelligence to understand client and market needs and create tangible business impact

Once you understand and perform the essential functions of a Market Data Analyst, you may have the opportunity to:
• Apply Python, SQL, VBA, Javascript, Machine Learning, Matlab and R to analyze data with the end goal of deriving insights, decreasing latency, increasing data quality efficiency, and market coverage
• Design database schemas, write and configure ETL (Extract Transform and Load) software, create business rules in code for quality checks, and configure end to end workflows to process data from acquisition to publishing
• Research data to improve processes, enhance workflow, reduce costs, drive value to the Terminal by suggesting/creating product enhancements
• Identify insights to generate news stories to make tangible business impact
• Use data science methods and statistical tools to bring on new datasets and identify patterns and trendsAt a minimum, we require that you:
• Earned a Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university prior to starting
• Can begin working full-time in 2019
• Are legally authorized to work full-time in the United States and will not require visa sponsorship now or in the futureYou also need to have:
• 0-2 years previous work/internship experience in information technology, engineering, finance, business management, data analysis or research
• Demonstrated project/work experience using one or more programming language
• Ability to recognize problems as well as identify and implement innovative solutions
• Basic knowledge of statistics and financial modeling
• Strong communication skills as well as the ability and desire to collaborate
• Prior coursework or involvement within a field related to the Financial Markets, Informatics, Mathematics, Economics, Business or other applied sciences
title: 2019 Market Data Analyst

body:

• Define solutions (metrics, designs, recommendations) to monitor and drive business operational processes

Python, Tableau & SQL
title: Data Analyst

body:
The primary role of the Patient Experience Data Analyst is to provide data management and analytic support for projects performed by the Network Performance Group in partnership with other clinical and non-clinical departments. The goal of the projects will be to improve the quality of care, patients' satisfaction with their care, and MMC's performance on the HCACHPS (Hospital Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems) survey. The Patient Experience Data Analyst will be responsible for continuous monitoring of data quality and interact with MMC's MIT department and relevant vendors to identify and resolve all data related issues. The position is hands on and will provide the necessary data and analytic support for various quality improvement and research projects, and as necessary, will provide regular reporting for ongoing performance monitoring activities, prepare sections of IRB applications as they pertain to data source, data quality and management, and will perform... literature searches to build understanding of evidence base in the area of patient experience.

Master's Degree required.

EXPERIENCE

--------------------

REQUIRED in any of the following:

• 3 - 5 years of experience in data analysis, data mining or analytics in healthcare related fields

• 3 - 5 years of experience working with EMR/Clinical databases and clinical or enterprise data warehouses as data or software analyst

• 3 - 5 years of experience working with and optimizing SQL queries and relational database schemas

OTHER REQUIRED SKILLS:

• Strong analytic skills and experience in basic statistical analyses using a statistical software (Stata preferred)

• Excellent interpersonal and writing skills

• Excellent presentation skills

• Demonstrated ability to take initiative

PREFERRED:

• Experience in clinical informatics and clinical terminologies (ICD9-10, LOINC, CPT, etc)

• Experience working with Epic EMR and associated data repositories

• Experience working with various types of health care data

• Some experience supporting quality improvement or research projects

body:
Technologies

sql, data-warehouse, excel

Job description

Data Analyst

Our Client are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data and Business Intelligence team in our Purchase, NY office.

The Data Analyst will interpret and analyze data and transform it into information for all business areas to support their decision making. Responsibilities span the full lifecycle activities including requirements analysis and design, development of analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuous monitoring of performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
• Perform Business and Data Analysis for data warehouse and end user data requests using SQL, and/or other reporting/data mining technologies tools
• Work with end users to determine data requirements for reporting requests, data mining requests, the development and delivery of both adhoc/recurring reports, and assisting with testing and implementation from a data lifecycle perspective
• Support all compliance technology... projects in the analysis, documentation, and socialization of data requirements in accordance with the needs of the technology program
• Collaborate with Information Architecture and Business Analysis teams in formulation of requirements for data across all product lines
• Develop appropriate data requirements documentation in line with SDLC framework including Data Requirements, mapping, and test plans
• Define data quality plans to address data quality issues; work with business partners to build business understanding of data issues
• Support day to day production inquiries and questions from other technology groups.
• Assist with the end to end project management of reporting and data development projects within the team
• Establish strong working relationships with team members and across the business as appropriate
• Handle individual workload and deliver upon project milestones on time and on budget
• Coordinate project tasks and timelines for data development within the team

Minimum Qualifications:
• The ideal candidate is a professional with 3 – 5 years of background as a data analyst and 3+ years of relevant experience with concentration in Data Analysis and Design
• Must have experience in property and casualty insurance or in financial services
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Must have experience working with large SQL databases
• Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
• Experience in data warehousing is a required
• Strong understanding of Excel
• Strong knowledge of relevant technology toolsets for data analysis and documentation including SQL, data modeling, metadata organization, data cleansing, and reporting tools such as Cognos, or other data reporting/data mining tools.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Excellent communication skills
• Ability to work in a team environment for resolution of issues

Education:
• BS in Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics
